question: Which among the following was the outcome of kesavanand Bharti Case v/s State of Kerala Case 1973?
option1: Preamble is Part of the constitution and subject to amending power of the parliament
option2: Preamble is Part of the constitution but not subject to amending power of the parliament
option3: Preamble is not a part of the constitution and is subject to amending power of the parliament
option4: Preamble is not a Part of the constitution and not subject to amending power of the parliament
answer: Preamble is Part of the constitution and subject to amending power of the parliament
explanation: In the Kesavananda Bharati Case v/s State of Kerala Case 1973 the Supreme Court opined that Preamble is part of the constitution and is subject to amending power of the parliament.
